page.title: 07HEATH CROFT ESTATE
page.content: In the 1800s the site was owned by a banker, Mr Hordern, and his family.They lived at Dunstall Hall which had lovely gardens. Unfortunately the gigantic and beautiful palace-like mansion was then demolished,only to build a factory that made synthetic yarns. In 1972 Courtalds closed down, the factory was demolished and the site became a wasteground. Courtaulds tried to sell the land but no-one wanted it. Tarmac Homes enquired but the answer was no. Eventually they got planning permission and Heath Croft was built.
